intro: Pouzolzia neilgherrensis, commonly known as the Himalayan pouzolzia, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky and well-drained soils. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive reddish or purple hue. It is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
